Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. said the specific quote mentioned.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the attribution of the quote to Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the quote belongs to Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. without proper verification.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the quote is a paraphrase of a more complex thought expressed by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
Falters at times: The claim falters by attributing quotes to Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. that he did not actually say.
Understate: The claim understates the issue by not acknowledging the prevalence of falsely attributed quotes to Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
Exaggerate: The claim does not appear to exaggerate any information.
